intro: Hedbergia abyssinica, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces fig-like fruits that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hedbergia abyssinica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
